column5: OOOOOHHHH yeah!  I just got off the phone with the land owner telling me "yes I can fish on his land as long as I keep it clean"!!!!!  Yeeeee HAAAAAAAAA  Now I can't wait for opener, otherwise I would have had to wait till the weekend was over to fish the other spots...  Oh I'm so happy as there are 3 pools holding fish on his land....  WEEEEEE (I feel like a kid right now... )
So, how did you you know this beforehand?    j/k, sounds like you have a nice spot there.
WHERE?
We all want to know now spill it
Let's hope no one in a kayak or pontoon is already there fishing your holes
Some prime water on the Don River!!!!!!
Only thing in that water is
Have you been bombarded with PM's yet?
LOL @ all of you... Beats, I was given a "look see" by others last year who had access but wouldn't let me fish with out permission. All I can say is DURHAM area...
Going to put a GPS tag on your car lol
Make sure you get the van then...
I got a bead on you ,when you visit up this way.
I should be up there at the end of the month for a family b-day party.  I'll see if I can bring my gear
Good going, Jeff...  have fun!
did you tell him you are bringing 200 of your closest OFC friends fishing with you  LOL
Being as you're in Brooklin, that makes sense.    Hey..do you know Mack the woodworker?

I dunno. If I took a buddy to one of my spots on private property, that I had gained permission for, and then he turned around and asked for and recieved permission, I'd be a little ticked off.......no??  Sinker
I think I read it the other way, his friend took him to see the water but told him he couldn't fish it till he got permission from the owner.... I don't know
Thats how i read it too
Just a little ticked off?

Correct.  I had seen people fishing there last year so I pulled over to say hi.  They let me come have a look see but told me I cannot fish with out consent of the land owner.  This year, I have it...  Dara, I might if he has a charter sticker on the back of his truck.  His father (if it is the person I'm thinking of) has the place by the C-store.

All I can say GBW is good for you; what you did/got will hopefully help other respectful people access. You got more then just access though; you gained the land ownerâ€™s respect and a possible future friendship. If more people did this there would be a lot less NO TRESPASSING signs. Thanks.  Dan.
Thanks Dan.  I have my gear packed and ready to go too!  Along with 5 garbage bags as the place looks to be a mess right now...

Nope GWB, he doesn't fish. He is a cranky old retired from Bell guy that is into turning pens right now. Lives in east of the CIBC I think.  Oh well, congrats on the permission  Signed Dara who lives in an area where there is no need to ask for permission to fish anywhere thankfully.
